Description:
(oPurposeTo support the Group’s M&A transactions, Finance needs to implement changes to its systems and processes.  The 'Manager, Finance Projects M&A' will lead work for Finance scope for a particular deal (acquisition or divestment). They will work with Finance and Technology teams to assess the impact of the deal and deliver the changes needed, and with Operations teams to identify and handle any dependencies (e.g. Billing-to-Cash and Procure-to-Pay processes).The role will also cover other work on Finance projects as needed, using Finance process knowledge to provide subject matter expertise on changes.This role will report into the Senior Manager, Finance Projects M&A.Key Responsibilities and AccountabilitiesAct as the single point of contact for Finance for an acquisition / divestment
Connect with both the M&A programme team and Finance partners
Chair meetings to align on status, project risks / issues, and set clear expectations of upcoming work and timelines
Communicate clearly and with precision, ensuring that key points can be easily understood
Agree scope, plan and milestones for Finance process scope
Handle inter-dependencies with other processes (e.g. billing to cash and procure to pay), to both ensure no scope creep into Finance and interlock for end-to-end testing
Produce all typical project documentation - e.g. detailed project plans, resource plans and status reports
Document business requirements to enable both technology to design and implement system changes, and business teams to understand impact to processes and resource needed to support ongoing work
Identify, assess and mitigate risks to the success of the project, particularly where there is an impact to deal timelines
Use experience to anticipate customer needs and solve problems
Use Finance SME knowledge to support Finance projects, including review of new demand, benefit cases and business outcomes, capturing requirements, reviewing proposed solutions, and performing business analysisQualifications and ExperienceDegree (or equivalent) and relevant professional qualification
Extensive knowledge and skills gained through experience in Finance integrations
Deep knowledge of a Finance function and complex financial systems infrastructuresSkills and CompetenciesNote:  Level 1 (awareness), level 2 (skilled), level 3 (advanced), level 4 (expert)Accounting principles: Applies knowledge of accounting practices and procedures to complete accounting assignments (Level 2)
Attention to detail: Demonstrates a concern for accuracy and thoroughness so that sufficiently detailed information is logged accurately (Level 2)
Communication: Communicates with clarity and precision, presenting complex information in a concise format that is audience appropriate (Level 3)
Data analysis: Collects, analyses and interprets data to reach conclusions and/or present insights and findings (Level 3)
Knowledge of financial systems: Understands how to use and operate within the organization's financial systems and related technologies. (Level 3)
Problem solving: Defines a problem, generates solutions, and evaluates and identifies the best solution to overcome the problem (Level 2)
Process improvement: Seeks new ways of working continuously to make processes run smoother and faster (Level 2)
Project planning and delivery: Demonstrates a structured approach to the discipline of planning, organising and handling resources and activities to achieve specified outcomes 
within a clearly defined timeframe and standards. (Level 2)
Relationship building: Interacts well with others, quickly establishing rapport building positive relationships and networks (Level 2)
